Case Facts: Driver was found transporting animals improperly, claiming they were just taking them to a vet.
Relevant Law: Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, Section 194 (Animal Transport Regulations) - Article 39

Case Facts: Motorist was caught speeding while being chased by another driver, claiming it was self-defense.
Driver was found without a working horn, stating they hadn’t realized it was broken.
Relevant Law: Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, Section 190 (Vehicle Condition) - Article 41

Case Facts: A person was caught using a vehicle for commercial purposes without a permit, stating they were helping a friend move.
Relevant Law: Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, Section 66 (Commercial Use) - Article 42

Case Facts: Driver failed to secure their load properly, leading to items falling on the road, claiming it was an accident.
Relevant Law: Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, Section 194 (Load Security) - Article 43

Case Facts: Motorist was caught driving a rented vehicle without proper authorization, stating it was a misunderstanding.
Relevant Law: Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, Section 66 (Unauthorized Use) - Article 44

Case Facts: Driver was found using the bus lane while driving alone, claiming they thought it was a mixed-use lane.
Relevant Law: Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, Section 177 (Lane Violation) - Article 45

Case Facts: A person was caught idling their vehicle in a no-idling zone, saying they were waiting for a friend.
Relevant Law: Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, Section 177 (Idling Violations) - Article 46

Case Facts: Driver was caught failing to use turn signals while changing lanes, claiming they forgot.
Relevant Law: Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, Section 121 (Turning Signals) - Article 47

Case Facts: Motorist was found driving on a footpath, stating they were avoiding a traffic jam.
Relevant Law: Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, Section 177 (Footpath Violation) - Article 48

Case Facts: A person was caught driving an electric vehicle without proper charging equipment, claiming it was lost.
Relevant Law: Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, Section 177 (Electric Vehicle Regulations) - Article 49

Case Facts: Driver was found driving with a cracked windshield, stating they planned to replace it soon.
Relevant Law: Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, Section 190 (Vehicle Condition) - Article 50

Case Facts: Motorist was caught using a vehicle to solicit business without proper licensing, claiming it was a one-time thing.
Relevant Law: Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, Section 66 (Unauthorized Commercial Use) - Article 51

Case Facts: Driver failed to yield to emergency vehicles, stating they didn’t hear the sirens.
Relevant Law: Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, Section 194 (Emergency Vehicle Regulations) - Article 52

Case Facts: A person was caught riding a scooter without a valid permit, claiming they were just practicing.
Relevant Law: Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, Section 3 (Driving Without Permit) - Article 53

Case Facts: Driver was found exceeding the passenger limit in a commercial vehicle, stating they didn’t know the rules.
Relevant Law: Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, Section 194 (Passenger Regulations) - Article 54

Case Facts: Motorist was caught attempting to evade tolls by taking an alternate route, stating it was unintentional.
Relevant Law: Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, Section 177 (Toll Evasion) - Article 55

Case Facts: Driver was found not maintaining proper distance from the vehicle in front, stating it was due to traffic.
Relevant Law: Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, Section 184 (Safe Following Distance) - Article 56

Case Facts: A person was caught driving with a child in the front seat without proper restraints, claiming they were only a few blocks away.
Relevant Law: Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, Section 180 (Child Safety) - Article 57

Case Facts: Driver was caught driving with an obstructed view, stating they were unaware it was a problem.
Relevant Law: Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, Section 190 (Clear View Requirement) - Article 58

Case Facts: Motorist was found cruising through a no-parking zone during peak hours, claiming they were just waiting for a spot.
Relevant Law: Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, Section 177 (No Parking Violation) - Article 59

Case Facts: Driver was caught using tinted windows exceeding the legal limit, stating they were for protection.
Relevant Law: Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, Section 177 (Tinted Window Regulations) - Article 60

Case Facts: A person was found driving under the influence of prescription medication, claiming it was legal.
Relevant Law: Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, Section 185 (Driving Under Influence) - Article 61

Case Facts: Caught speeding at 120 km/h in a 60 km/h zone
Driving above the speed limit of 100 km/h in a zone
Ran a red light and collided with another vehicle
Outcome: Fined 5,000 and license suspension for 3 months
Relevant Law: Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, Section on Traffic Signals

Case Facts: Failed to stop at a red light and caused a minor crash
Relevant Law: Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, Section on Traffic Signals

Case Facts: Driving without a helmet on a motorcycle
Riding a two-wheeler without a helmet
Caused an accident while using a mobile phone
Using a mobile phone while driving and caused a crash
Parked in a no-parking zone, blocking traffic
Vehicle abandoned in a no-parking area, causing issues
Driving under the influence of alcohol, BAC 0.09%
Outcome: License suspension for 1 year and fined 10,000

Case Facts: Driving while intoxicated, BAC 0.12%
Outcome: License suspension for 6 months and fined 15,000

Case Facts: Used a loud horn in a silent zone
Honked continuously near a hospital zone
Failed to yield to an ambulance
Driving above the speed limit on a highway
Exceeded speed limit of 80 km/h in a residential area
Failed to stop at a red light, causing a minor accident
Relevant Law: Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, Section on Traffic Signals

Case Facts: Drove without stopping at a pedestrian crossing
